hillbillies.model

Class Faction

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Faction

  • public class Faction
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing a set of units.
    Invariant:
    The number of units in this faction must be less than or equal to MAX_UNITS.
        this.getFactionSize() <= MAX_UNITS

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_UNITS 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Faction()
      Create a new faction which contains no units.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addUnit(Unit unit)
      Adds the given unit to this faction.
      int getFactionSize()
      Returns the size of the faction.
      Scheduler getScheduler()
      Returns the scheduler for this faction.
      java.util.Set<Unit> getUnits()
      Returns all units in the faction.
      void removeUnit(Unit unit)
      Removes the given unit from the faction.
      void terminate()
      Terminates this faction.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_UNITS

        public static final int MAX_UNITS
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Faction

        public Faction()
        Create a new faction which contains no units.
        Postcondition:
        The faction size will be zero.

    • Method Detail

      • addUnit

        public void addUnit(Unit unit)
        Adds the given unit to this faction.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit to be added to this faction.
        Postcondition:
        If the faction size is less than MAX_UNITS, the faction will now contain the unit.
        Effect:
        If the faction size is less than MAX_UNITS, the units faction is set to this faction.
            unit.setFaction(this)

      • getFactionSize

        @Basic
public int getFactionSize()
        Returns the size of the faction.

      • getUnits

        @Basic
public java.util.Set<Unit> getUnits()
        Returns all units in the faction.

      • removeUnit

        public void removeUnit(Unit unit)
        Removes the given unit from the faction.
        Parameters:
        unit - The unit to be removed.
        Postcondition:
        The factions will not contain the unit and if the faction previously contained the unit, the units faction is set to null.

      • getScheduler

        @Basic
public Scheduler getScheduler()
        Returns the scheduler for this faction.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Terminates this faction.
        Effects:
      • Terminates each unit in this faction.
      • Terminates the scheduler for this unit.
